guicomponents
Class G4P

java.lang.Object
  guicomponents.G4P
All Implemented Interfaces:
GConstants
public class G4P
extends java.lang.Object
implements GConstants

This class has only static methods. It keeps track of all GComponents created. Its primary role is encapsulated in the draw() method which can override the default Processing drawing mechanism.

Author:
Peter Lager

public static void setMouseOverEnabled(boolean enable)
Enables or disables cursor over component change This is ignored if no G4P components have been created yet

public static void cursor(int cursorOff,

Inform G4P which cursor shapes will be used. Initial values are ARROW (off) and HAND (over)

addComponent

public static void addComponent(GComponent c)
INTERNAL USE ONLY This should be called by all ctors in GComponent and since all GUI components inherit from GComponent and are required to call a GComponent ctor then all GUI components will automatically be registered in the set.

Parameters:
c - the component that has been created.

setColorScheme

public static void setColorScheme(PApplet theApplet,
                                  int schemeNo)
Set the color scheme to be used by G4P
Only reqd if different from the default blue scheme to be global specify before creating GUI components Available schemes: BLUE_SCHEME, GREEN_SCHEME, RED_SCHEME, PURPLE_SCHEME YELLOW_SCHEME, CYAN_SCHEME, GREY_SCHEME

Parameters:
theApplet -
schemeNo - GCScheme.GREEN_SCHEME

Set the font type and size to be used by G4P
Only reqd if different from the default "Serif" 11
to be global specify before creating GUI components

fontSize - font size

setPeasyCam

public static boolean setPeasyCam(java.lang.Object pcam)
This method is called once to initialise a PeasyCam object.

Parameters:
pcam - a previously created PeasyCam object.
Returns:
true if it can initialise a PeasyCam object else false.

draw

public static void draw()
This method is provided to simplify using G4P with PeasyCam.
If the PeasyCam object has been set then a parameter and it will automatically call the beginHUD and endHUD methods for you. 
 pcam.beginHUD();
 G4P.draw();
 pcam.endHUD();
becomes 
 G4P.draw();

draw

public static void draw(PApplet app)
When you first use G4P(app) it switches off auto draw for the PApplet app.

disableAutoDraw

public static void disableAutoDraw()
Once disabled you need to call G4P.draw() from the draw() method if you wish to see the GUI ever again!

isAutoDrawOn

public static boolean isAutoDrawOn()
Is autodraw on for the main PApplet window?

isAutoDrawOn

public static boolean isAutoDrawOn(PApplet app)
Is autodraw on for the PApplet app?

messagesEnabled

public static void messagesEnabled(boolean enable)
G4P has a range of support messages eg
if you create a GUI component without an event handler or,
a slider where the visible size of the slider is less than the difference between min and max values. This method allows the user to enable (default) or disable this option. If disable then it should be called before any GUI components are created.

Parameters:
enable -
